22-032CH.summary: Recommendation to receive and file the Cultural Heritage Commission Minutes of July 26, 2022.Page 1 of 8411 W. OCEAN BLVDCIVIC CHAMBERS ANDTELECONFERENCE, 5:00 PMTUESDAY, AUGUST 30, 2022CITY OF LONG BEACHCULTURAL HERITAGE COMMISSION MINUTESA motion was made by Commissioner Hinds, seconded by Commissioner Hunter to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 5 - Mark Grisafe, Mary Hinds, Tasha Hunter, Kevin McGuan and Kathleen IrvineAbsent: 1 - Lourdes RamosDIRECTOR'S REPORTChristopher Koontz, Acting Director of Development Services, spoke.Chair Irvine spoke.Christopher Koontz, Acting Director of Development Services, spoke.Chair Irvine spoke.Andréa Urbas, Acting Advance Planning Officer, spoke.Chair Irvine spoke.SWEARING OF WITNESSESDo you solemnly swear or affirm that the evidence you shall give in this Cultural Heritage Commission meeting shall be the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth.REGULAR AGENDA1.

22-035CH.summary: Recommendation to approve a Certificate of Appropriateness to demolish an existing garage, construct a 684-square-foot rear detached three-car garage with a 114-square-foot storage/laundry room and a 798-square-foot Accessory Dwelling Unit (ADU) above, at the rear of the lot. The proposed project at 916 Coronado Avenue is in the Two-Family Residential - Standard Lots (R-2-N) Zoning District and is a contributor to the Rose Park Historic District. No changes are proposed to the primary residence at the front of the lot. (District 2)Page 2 of 8411 W. OCEAN BLVDCIVIC CHAMBERS ANDTELECONFERENCE, 5:00 PMTUESDAY, AUGUST 30, 2022CITY OF LONG BEACHCULTURAL HERITAGE COMMISSION MINUTESAndrea Urbas, Acting Advance Planning Officer, introduced Miguel Samayoa, Project Planner, who presented the staff report.Chair Irvine spoke.Commissioner Grisafe spoke.Christopher Koontz, Acting Director of Development Services, spoke.Commissioner Grisafe spoke.Chair Irvine spoke.Trina Taylor, Applicant, spoke.Chair Irvine spoke.Elise Roberts, Planning Analyst, spoke.Chair Irvine spoke.A motion was made by Commissioner Hunter, seconded by Commissioner Grisafe, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 5 - Mark Grisafe, Mary Hinds, Tasha Hunter, Kevin McGuan and Kathleen IrvineAbsent: 1 - Lourdes Ramos2.

22-033CH.summary: A request that the Cultural Heritage Commission review the landmark nomination, background materials and recommend that the City Council designate a one-story commercial building located at 822 Willow Street as a Historic Landmark. (District 7)Chair Irvine spoke.Andréa Urbas, Acting Advance Planning Officer, spoke.Chair Irvine spoke.Erin Weesner-McKinley, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Page 3 of 8411 W. OCEAN BLVDCIVIC CHAMBERS ANDTELECONFERENCE, 5:00 PMTUESDAY, AUGUST 30, 2022CITY OF LONG BEACHCULTURAL HERITAGE COMMISSION MINUTESChair Irvine spoke.Erin Weesner-McKinley, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Chair Irvine spoke.Elise Roberts, Planning Analyst, spoke.Chair Irvine spoke.Commissioner Hunter spoke.Christopher Koontz, Acting Director of Development Services, spoke.Commissioner Hunter spoke.A motion was made by Vice Chair McGuan, seconded by Commissioner Hinds, to continue item to November 29, 2022.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 5 - Mark Grisafe, Mary Hinds, Tasha Hunter, Kevin McGuan and Kathleen IrvineAbsent: 1 - Lourdes Ramos3.

22-034CH.summary: Recommendation to approve a Certificate of Appropriateness to construct a 371 square-foot single-story rear addition with a 33 square-foot rear porch to a single-family residence and to demolish a rear patio cover. The property is located at 922 Molino Avenue, in the R-2-N Zoning District. The existing dwelling is a contributor to the Rose Park Historic District. (District 2) Andrea Urbas, Acting Advance Planning Officer, introduced Irving Anaya, Project Planner, who presented the staff report.Chair Irvine spoke.Irving Anaya, Project Planner, spoke.Chair Irvine spoke.Commissioner Grisafe spoke.Page 4 of 8411 W. OCEAN BLVDCIVIC CHAMBERS ANDTELECONFERENCE, 5:00 PMTUESDAY, AUGUST 30, 2022CITY OF LONG BEACHCULTURAL HERITAGE COMMISSION MINUTESAlejandro Plascencia, Planner, spoke.Commissioner Grisafe spoke.Chair Irvine spoke.Karen Hewus, Applicant spoke.Chair Irvine spoke.Karen Hewus, Applicant, spoke.Commissioner Grisafe spoke.Karen Hewus, Applicant, spoke.Commissioner Grisafe spoke.Karen Hewus, Applicant, spoke.Chair Irvine spoke.Elise Roberts, Planning Analyst, spoke.Chair Irvine spoke.Christopher Koontz, Acting Director of Development Services, spoke.Chair Irvine spoke.A motion was made by Commissioner Hinds, seconded by Vice Chair McGuan, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 5 - Mark Grisafe, Mary Hinds, Tasha Hunter, Kevin McGuan and Kathleen IrvineAbsent: 1 - Lourdes Ramos4.
